page.title: 12CANTERBURY SEWAGE WORKS
page.content: This plant operates every day each year and serves a population of 44,200 people and eight industries from the City of Canterbury and the outlying areas of Blean, Broadoak, Fordwich, Sturry, Tyler Hill and parts of Thanington. The main problem here in 1985 is the smell from the sludge which is piled in long columns 10-12 feet high, 80 yards long in rows of up to 10. Limes and polymers are added to this sludge which is then covered with straw until over the years it decomposes and can be used by local farmers. A very primitive wild deodourizing agent is sprayed into the air to kill the smell of gases produced at this stage of treatment. In the hot summers they are not very effective and according to wind direction most of the area suffers from these foul odours.
